item.title: Deobfuscating a client
item.dc:creator: @S_v2 .S. v2
item.description:
@S_v2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:10, topic:490633”][quote author=.S. v2 link=topic=608866.msg4233085#msg4233085 date=1361408488]
Could you upload a class file from the client so we know what we’re dealing with here?

if all you want is to just change the ip all you need to do is extract the client.class from the jar and hex edit it

thats your simplest solution…

Not necessarily. Many Java obfuscators make use of simple (reversible) string encryption.
[/quote][/quote]

stfu IAbstractIntNodeListListener

Read full topic

item.title: Deobfuscating a client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“pennies4tim, post:6, topic:490633”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=608866.msg4232687#msg4232687 date=1361377646]

If you have winrar, you can use that to get the class files of the client. Then, you must convert the class files to Java files, which isn’t hard because I do it all the time to mess around.
[/quote]

I’ve tried this, but I just get a lot of errors when I try to recompile it.[/quote]
The errors must be fixed then. Every client you see here, when it first started, had to be fixed 100% in order to recompile. Decompiling a java class file is not going to give you an exact replica of the source.

Read full topic

item.title: Deobfuscating a client
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Deobfuscate:
To deobfuscate is to convert a program that is difficult to understand into one that is simple, understandable and straightforward.

Many techniques have been evaluated to reverse-engineer obfuscated code. The three main techniques for deobfuscating code are:

Selective cloning Constraint-based static path feasibility A combination of static and dynamic analysis

If you have winrar, you can use that to get the class files of the client. Then, you must convert the class files to Java files, which isn’t hard because I do it all the time to mess around.

Read full topic

item.title: Deobfuscating a client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Thats not deobfuscating a client at all, thats called programming a client. To change the IP try to find something like one of these. Its just just as easy as loading up a program and letting it do all of the work for you. You actually need to put your foot down and figure it out.

String server
or
String serverip
